intro: Galium incanum, commonly known as silverweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, white or pale flowers that appear in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, silvery hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Galium incanum is a perennial herb that thrives in woodland and meadow environments.
